title: Bath beat Exeter in close fought encounter in dire weather conditions
text:
Bath 13 Exeter 10

Rob Baxter slammed the discipline of his Exeter Chiefs side as they were edged out by a gritty Bath side in dire conditions at the Rec.

A first-half try from Tom Dunn plus eight points from the boot of Rhys Priestland was enough to secure their first Premiership win of the Stuart Hooper era. Exeter scored one try of their own courtesy of Jonny Hill with Joe Simmonds kicking five points.

“I lost my temper with the lads in the changing room because I do feel like as much as Bath pressurised us you don’t really create a high tackle,” said Baxter.

“If you give away penalties like that you are handing back momentum to the opposition and it’s game over especially in such bad conditions. I’m frustrated because not only did we do it once or twice we then refused to learn our lessons.

“When you don’t learn your lessons that’s more annoying than anything else.”

Exeter dominated the first-half with the Bath defence repelling wave after wave of sustained pressure as they lay siege to the home sides line. But Bath’s defensive line was only breached once when Hill powered his way over from short range.
